item.title: Data Analysis on Civil Forfeiture
item.description: I came across one episode of John Oliver called civil forfeiture, I find this topic quite disturbing. Civil Forfeiture Law basically give the law enforcement the right to take and keep asset regardless of the owner’s guilt or innocence. I come across a website called Policing for Profit which provide data related to this topic. I have been mulling this blog post for a while, here is some result that I find out, let’s take a look at see what’s up!

item.title: Leading Cause of Death in the United States
item.description: In this post I want to review the trend of leading causes of deaths in United States. Specially how fast the age adjusted rate decase in each state. The data come from CDC. The main variable I try to analysis in this post is age-adjusted death rates. Pacakge and Data library(tidyverse) library(jsonlite) library(fuzzyjoin) library(transformr) # devtools::install_github("thomasp85/transformr") library(sf) library(gganimate) library(geofacet) library(ggrepel) theme_set(theme_minimal()) death_data <- read_csv("/Users/yifeiliu/Documents/R/data/EDA/leading_death.csv") death_data <- death_data %>% dplyr::rename(year = Year, all_cause = `113 Cause Name`, cause = `Cause Name`, state = State, deaths = Deaths, aadr = `Age-adjusted Death Rate`) death_data_processed <- death_data %>% select(- all_cause) %>% dplyr::filter(!

item.title: Analyze U.S. Census Data using Tidycensus
item.description: Just fininsh Tidycensus class on Datacamp which is called Analyzing US Census Data in R so I think it will will a great opportunity for me to practice my data visualization skills. Show Pennsylvania Median Income You need to obtain a API code from U.S. Census and set it up in .Rprofile. library(tidyverse) library(tidycensus) library(ggplot2) library(purrr) library(dplyr) library(shiny) library(viridis) library(tmap) library(sf) library(plotly) # devtools::install_github('thomasp85/gganimate') library(gganimate) # census_api_key(key = "Your API Keys") library(ggthemes) library(mapview) Next we need to find median income data, you can use load_variables function to find the variables name that you want to find, you can also use Census Reporter to browser different categories of data.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m Yifei Liu and I want to be a Data Analyst. I like making interesting charts, quality of government, Financial Engineer, anime, and R. I’m currently a student at Temple Universtiy Fox School major in Financial Analyst and Risk Management. I will graduate in 2019. You can find me on Twitter, Github and linkedin I current live in Philadelphia. My blog posts are released under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License

item.title: Resume
item.description: Resume Core Competencies Modeling Able to apply sophisticated mathematics to understanding data. Proficient in the modern machine learning toolkit, including supervised and unsupervised learning techniques. Also have basic understanding of other common technically analsis toolkit such as survival analysis and time series analysis. Skills and Tools R, Python, Matlab Github, Markdown, Shell Script Excel, Bloomberg, CapitalIQ CFA level II Candidate FRM level II Candidate Experience Financial Analyst, Bank of China Fuxin Branch, Fuxin, China June 2016 – April 2017
